full_summary:
**Title**: Hog’s Back Swing Bridge Maintenance Services Contract
**Reference Number**: PW-23-01025945
**Tender Closing Date**: March 29, 2023, 3:00 p.m. DST

**Description**

The National Capital Commission (NCC) is issuing a Request for Proposal for the provision of maintenance services for the bridge systems of the Hog’s Back Swing Bridge. The services are essential for maintaining the bridge in a safe and reliable operational condition, ensuring it remains available for operation during its designated navigational operating season. The Contractor is expected to perform immediate repairs to any systems failures or malfunctions.

**Contract Term**

The contract will be executed for a period of five (5) consecutive years, effective May 15, 2023, and ending on October 30, 2023. The Contracting Authority may exercise an option to extend the contract term by one (1) additional year, subject to the same terms and conditions.

**Mandatory Site Visit**

A mandatory site visit is scheduled for February 28, 2023, from 10:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. (EST). Bidders are required to confirm their attendance by email to the Contracting Authority by February 24, 2023. All costs associated with the site visit will be borne by the Bidder, and the NCC will not reimburse any expenses related to the visit.

**Bid Submission**

Bids must be submitted electronically by 3:00 p.m. DST on March 29, 2023, to Bids-soumissions@ncc-ccn.ca with a reference to contract file #MA064. Fax and hard copy bids will not be accepted.

**Inquiries and Communications**

To ensure the integrity of the Contract/RFSO process, all inquiries and communications must be directed to Micheline Al-Koutsi, Senior Contract Officer, by email at micheline.al-koutsi@ncc-ccn.ca. The NCC will not respond to inquiries regarding the Contract process. Bidders are required to review the tender document and all addenda in their entirety to ensure compliance with the Contract requirements.

**Trade Agreements**

The procurement process of this contract is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).
